author: Yaroslav Trofimov
title: Elections Are Coming in Middle East—but Change Isn’t
text:
DUBAI—It’s election season in the Middle East. The fact that few seem to care about the outcome of these votes shows just how much authoritarian restoration and sectarian conflict transformed the region after the 2011 Arab Spring briefly stoked its peoples’ democratic hopes.

The Arab world’s most populous country—Egypt—is holding a presidential election this month. Lebanon will pick a new parliament and government on May 6, its first national election in nearly a decade. A week later, Iraqis will go to the polls for the first...
